columns.text: This exercise will determine the present value of an investment that will provide $80,000 in ten years with an appropriate discount of 9% compounded daily.

The present value refers to the current value of the future cash flow. It is calculated by discounting the future value using a specified discount rate. The present value can be computed using the formula as follows:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Present Value} &=\dfrac{{FV}_{t}}{\left(1 + r\right)^{t}}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$FV$, which refers to the cash flow
$t$, which represent the period
$r$, which indicate the discount rate

First off, the problem stated that the 9% discount rate is compounded daily for ten years; thus, the appropriate period and rate we will consider in our computation is the daily equivalent of the discount rate and the period.

Given that:

| | | 
|--|--| 
| Annual payment| $80,000| 
|Rate |9% compounded daily | 
|Time |10 years |

To determine the period to be used, we will multiply the ten years term by the number of days in a year.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{T}_2 &= 10\times365
\\[5pt]
&= {3650}
\end{aligned}$$

Thus, the period we will consider in our calculation is the daily equivalent of ten years which is 3650.

To conclude, since the provided discount rate is compounded daily, we have determined the present value of the investment by computing and considering the daily equivalent of the rate and period in our calculation. Hence, our calculation shows the $32,529.18 value of the investment.
